word:
Elder Andrews might have lived had he encouraged and trained others to share the burdens he loaded himself down with. He deprived others of an education they might have had, because he did so much himself and allowed them to rely upon his brain, in place of doing their own thinking. Every man can be a man, a whole man, by patient continuance in well-doing, by resolutely 


                                 -292- 

overcoming cowardice and ignorance and inefficiency, with thoughtful energy and zeal.
